frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What does CSS stand for?
What is the purpose of HTML?
options: To structure and present content on the web
To define the styling of web pages
To store and retrieve data on the server

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the role of JavaScript in web development?
options: To add interactivity and dynamic features to web pages
To define the visual layout of web pages

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
options: To contain metadata and document information
To define the visible content of the web page
To specify the main heading of the web page
To define the navigation links of the web page

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the correct way to include an external JavaScript file in an HTML document?
What is the box model in CSS?
options: It describes how elements are rendered as rectangular boxes
It defines the size of the web page
It determines the layout of text on the web page
It specifies the color and background of elements

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS property 'display: none'?
options: To hide an element from the web page
To make an element visible on the web page
To align an element to the center of its container
To add a border around an element

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What does the acronym 'HTTP' stand for?
What is the purpose of media queries in CSS?
options: To apply different styles based on the device's screen size
To specify the font styles and sizes
To add images and videos to the web page

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the role of a CSS preprocessor?
options: To extend CSS with variables, nesting, and functions
To optimize the performance of CSS files

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in the HTML 'img' tag?
options: To provide alternative text for screen readers and when the image cannot be displayed
To define the alignment of the image on the web page
To specify the width and height of the image
To add a caption below the image

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the difference between margin and padding in CSS?
options: Margin is the space outside an element, while padding is the space inside an element
Margin is the space inside an element, while padding is the space outside an element
Margin and padding are used interchangeably and have the same meaning
Margin and padding are used to define the same type of space around an element

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'float' property in CSS?
options: To allow an element to wrap around a floated element
To align an element vertically within its container
To make an element appear above other elements on the web page
To apply a 3D transformation to an element

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'box-sizing' property in CSS?
options: To control how the total width and height of an element is calculated
To specify the position of an element within its parent container
To add a border around an element
To define the background color of an element

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the role of the 'querySelectorAll' method in JavaScript?
options: To select multiple elements from the DOM based on a CSS selector
To select the first element from the DOM based on a CSS selector
To modify the style of an element
To create a new HTML element dynamically

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript?
options: To store data locally in the user's web browser
To make HTTP requests to a server
To add event listeners to elements

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the role of the 'async' attribute in the HTML 'script' tag?
options: To specify that the script should be executed asynchronously
To define the source URL of the script
To add a delay before executing the script
To load the script only when the page has finished loading

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'transition' property in CSS?
options: To create smooth animations between CSS property changes
To specify the font family of the text
To control the visibility of an element
To define the layout of table cells

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'flexbox' layout in CSS?
options: To create flexible and responsive layouts
To add animation effects to elements
To define the font styles and sizes

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the role of the 'addEventListener' method in JavaScript?
options: To attach an event handler function to an element
To create a new HTML element dynamically
To select multiple elements from the DOM based on a CSS selector
To store data locally in the user's web browser

frontendWebDevQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the 'fetch' function in JavaScript?
options: To make HTTP requests and retrieve data from a server
To add interactivity and dynamic features to web pages
To align an element to the center of its container
To specify the width and height of an image

What is the process called when an airplane moves along the ground under its own power?
Which component of an airplane's landing gear is responsible for absorbing the shock of landing?
What is the purpose of the flaps on an airplane's wings?
options: To increase lift during takeoff and landing

airplaneQuestions.question: Which instrument is used to measure the rate at which an airplane is climbing or descending?
Which type of aircraft is designed to operate from both land and water?
What is the purpose of an airplane's spoilers?
options: To reduce lift and increase drag
